parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear brake system can cause a loss of braking power, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The rear brake pedal becomes extremely hard to press
the rear brake pedal depresses all the way down with no braking power
the front brake lever becomes difficult to squeeze

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS module can cause the rear brake system to fail, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: the rear brake pedal becomes extremely hard to press
the rear brake pedal depresses all the way down with no braking power
the front brake lever becomes difficult to squeeze

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake line can cause a loss of braking power, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The rear brake pedal becomes extremely hard to press
the rear brake pedal depresses all the way down with no braking power
the front brake lever becomes difficult to squeeze

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS module can cause the loss of all brakes on the motorcycle, leaving the rider and other motorists at risk.
symptoms: ABS module failure after software update or maintenance.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the throttle system can cause the throttle to go into limp mode, resulting in a loss of power and control, which can lead to accidents or near-misses.
symptoms: sudden loss of throttle response while riding.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of sensors in the throttle system can cause the throttle to malfunction, leading to a loss of control and increased risk of accidents.
The failure of the ETC system can cause the throttle to malfunction, leading to a loss of control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: sudden loss of throttle response while riding.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the compensator sprocket can cause the drive train to lock up, leading to a loss of control, accidents, and potentially severe injuries or fatalities.

The failure of the auto-adjusted chain tensioner can cause excessive wear on components, leading to premature failure, and potentially causing the drive train to lock up, leading to accidents and injuries.
The failure of the electrical system can cause the bike to go into limp mode, reducing power and speed, and potentially leading to accidents or loss of control.

The failure of the electronic throttle control system can cause the loss of throttle control, leading to a sudden loss of power and acceleration, which can be extremely dangerous, especially at high speeds, and may result in accidents or near-miss situations.
symptoms: engine still running but no throttle response
error codes indicating electronic throttle response failure.
